item.title: Anvil
item.description:
Description

Meredydd gave a talk about Anvil to Python Frederick, a Python user group in Frederick, MD. Thanks for joining us!
item.dc:creator: Meredydd Luff

item.title: batou - a multi-(component|environment|platform|.*) deployment tool
item.description:
Description

batou is a service deployment utility inspired by tools like Puppet, Fabric, and other modern tools. It made a short appearance in a lightning talk and at the sprints during EP 2012.

The talk gives an overview and demonstrates with practical examples how we deploy web applications with many complex components:

  • modelling service components with Python
  • multiple environments
  • multiple platforms
  • development environments
  • convergent behaviour
  • remote deployments
  • secrets management (database passwords, SSL certificates, …)
  • no additional run-time dependencies

I will show how the real-life requirements in our projects led us to develop a general model that integrates existing practices without building a huge stack of technologies.
item.dc:creator: Christian Theune

item.title: Analisi dati e grafici con Genropy e Pandas
item.description:
Description

Genropy è un framework per la creazione di Single Page Applications che offre ad utenti e sviluppatori un ambiente di lavoro molto comodo per il caricamento e la gestione dei dati. In questo talk parleremo degli strumenti messi a disposizione per l’analisi dei dati e la rappresentazione grafica, tabellare e in dashboard. Parleremo in particolare dell’integrazione con Pandas e di come sia facile anche per un utente non particolarmente esperto generare pivot table, e creare colonne calcolate e mostrare i risultati come grafici.
item.dc:creator: Francesco Porcari

item.title: weppy: the web framework for humans
item.description:
Description

Why another python web framework? Do we really need to innovate the Django and Flask scene? Could we? This talk will address all these questions, introducing weppy: the full stack python web framework designed with simplicity in mind.
item.dc:creator: Giovanni Barillari
